section.p: Cloud computing, often referred to as the cloud, is the delivery of on-demand computing resources over the internet. can be integrated into a public or private cloud solution, and installed on stand-alone hypervisors, including vSphere, XenServer, and VirtualBox. Virtual Edition can also be deployed in the SoftLayer cloud on virtual and bare metal servers, and in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2).

Installing on servers through virtualization technology provides a number of benefits:
You can improve the utilization of hardware by using virtualization.
You can reduce the costs of hardware operation and maintenance by being able to deploy the virtual resources that you need.
You can use cloud computing to innovate quickly by being able to rapidly build cloud applications. The applications that you develop can then be deployed into development, test, and production environments.

section.p: When you deploy your virtual image, you choose the operating system and the amount of CPU and RAM that you want. If the available disk space is insufficient, a warning is displayed. You can then choose to resize the amount of available disk space during deployment by using vendor-specific deployment tools. Alternatively, you can continue to work with the existing disk size. You might want to continue to work with the existing disk size if, for example, you are using your virtual machine instance for only QoS 0 messages. These messages are non-persistent and therefore are not stored.
